DataElement.preferredName: Vaginal Brachytherapy Isodose Length Administered Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the length of the isodose line measured along the axis of the vagina.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the isodose (a radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area) length (the linear extent in space from one end to the other) of vaginal brachytherapy administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the vagina or to any sheath.:(ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the vagina.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

Property.preferredDefinition: A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.:Length; the linear extent in space from one end to the other.:Given.

Concepts.definition: A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the length of the isodose line.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ValueDomain.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
